summary.p: 4 fol. on parchment; Shelfmark: Marcel 48; Qurʾānic Text: Q 11:60-11:63, Q 23:89-23:91; 5 lines per page; Dimensions: 260 x 180mm; Script style: kūfī D.III.
The fragments Marcel 49 (NLR) and probably also Arabe 357 (BNF), Ms. orient. A 435 and A 461 (Gotha) belong to the same manuscript.

This entry was created on the basis of the information made available by Valery V. Polosin (1939-2014), without use of manuscript images. Therefore, the exact distribution of the Qurʾānic passages across the manuscript pages is unknown to us, and all the passages are shown as belonging to fol. 1. The catalogue entry by Polosin contains the following information:
"Marcel 48
4 fol. 180×260 mm (1.444). Support: thin transparent parchment of yellowish color, with traces of polishing. Writing material: dark brown to black ink.
Collation: fragments from two quires, fol. 1 is singleton with a stub, fol. 2–3 are a bifolium; the inner margin of fol. 4 has been trimmed.
I: H1F H2F / F3H S;
II: F4H.

Text layout: 86×156 mm (1.8), 5 lines. Ruling: absent. Script: D III. Diacritics: occasional green horizontal dashes; the missing alifs of the long ā, as well as shaddah on fol. 4r., are added in green paint. Vocalization: red, yellow and green round dots.

Verse markers: for individual verses – trefoil (type 2.2.3b) in gold and colors; for groups of ten verses – medallions on the margins (type 2.A.II) in gold and colors with the inscribed numbers of verses (ثمنون – fol. 2v, تسعون – fol. 4r).
Stitching: threads are preserved in the punctures of the fold.
Traces of old conservation: margins have probably been trimmed.
Defects: stains on the first and last sheets; ink peeling off on the flesh side of some sheets.

Attached materials: old wrapping (fol. I) consisting of a narrow strip of paper inscribed with the brief description of the manuscript in French in brown ink – “5me c. / 5 lignes 4 feuil” and old accession number in red pencil “B. 26”.
Old accession numbers: B. 26 (on the wrapping and according to Langlois’ inventory).
Contents:
Fol. 1r–3v. Surah 11, verses 63(60) - 66(63). Incipit: [في هذ]ه الدنيا لعنة . Explicit: منْهُ رَحمةً [فَمَن ينصُرني] .
Fol. 4r–4v. Surah 23, verses 91(89)-93(91). Incipit: [تَعلمون * سَيَقو]لون لله. Explicit: بعضهم على [بعض سبحان الله].
Other fragments of the same manuscript: Marcel 49 (NLR); probably also Arabe 357 (BNF), Gotha 435 and Gotha 461."
Olga Yastrebova has translated and sometimes corrected the notes of V. Polosin. Corrected passages are marked with ОЯ (O.Ya).
